thread.title: Dele Alli sees red for HORROR tackle during Tottenham's Europa League clash against Gent
thread.title_full: Dele Alli sees red for HORROR tackle during Tottenham's Europa League clash against Gent

author: Jacob Murtagh
title: Dele Alli sees red for HORROR tackle during Tottenham's Europa League clash against Gent
text:
Dele Alli sees red for HORROR tackle during Tottenham's Europa League clash against Gent The England youngster received his marching orders for a nasty challenge on Brecht Dejaegere before the break Share Dele Alli is sent off for this lunge (Photo: Offside Sports Photography) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Dele Alli was sent off for a horror challenge during Tottenham's Europa League tie against Gent. 
The Spurs star clattered into Gent midfielder Brecht Dejaegere five minutes before the break at Wembley. 
Alli appeared to be riled up after he felt he was fouled moments earlier before his reckless tackle earned him an early bath. 
It is the first time the 20-year-old has been red-carded in his professional career, although he has been booked five times so far this season. Alli flies into Brecht Dejaegere The Spurs star clatters into Dejaegere (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Alli receives his marching orders (Photo: PA) 
Christian Eriksen had fired Mauricio Pochettino's men in front in their round of 32 second leg against the Belgian side. 
However, Harry Kane put through his own net to level the scores on the night and restore Gent's one-goal aggregate advanatge. 
More to follow.
